OnConnectedToMaster() OnConnectedToMasterLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnConnectedToMaster
override void Launcher_old.OnConnectedToMaster ( )[virtual]
Called when the client is connected to the Master Server and ready for matchmaking and other tasks.
The list of available rooms won't become available unless you join a lobby via LoadBalancingClient.OpJoinLobby. You can join rooms and create them even without being in a lobby. The default lobby is used in that case.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.

OnCreateRoomFailed() OnCreateRoomFailedLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnCreateRoomFailed
override void Launcher_old.OnCreateRoomFailed (short returnCode, string message)[virtual]
Called when the server couldn't create a room (OpCreateRoom failed).
The most common cause to fail creating a room, is when a title relies on fixed room-names and the room already exists.
Parameters
returnCode
Operation ReturnCode from the server.
message
Debug message for the error.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.

OnJoinedLobby() OnJoinedLobbyLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnJoinedLobby
override void Launcher_old.OnJoinedLobby ( )[virtual]
Called on entering a lobby on the Master Server.
The actual room-list updates will call OnRoomListUpdate.
While in the lobby, the roomlist is automatically updated in fixed intervals (which you can't modify in the public cloud). The room list gets available via OnRoomListUpdate.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.
Definition at line 44 of file Launcher_Old.cs. Here is the call graph for this function:
OnJoinedRoom() OnJoinedRoomLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnJoinedRoom
override void Launcher_old.OnJoinedRoom ( )[virtual]
Called when the LoadBalancingClient entered a room, no matter if this client created it or simply joined.
When this is called, you can access the existing players in Room.Players, their custom properties and Room.CustomProperties.
In this callback, you could create player objects. For example in Unity, instantiate a prefab for the player.
If you want a match to be started "actively", enable the user to signal "ready" (using OpRaiseEvent or a Custom Property).
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.
Definition at line 64 of file Launcher_Old.cs. Here is the call graph for this function:
OnLeftRoom() OnLeftRoomLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnLeftRoom
override void Launcher_old.OnLeftRoom ( )[virtual]
Called when the local user/client left a room, so the game's logic can clean up it's internal state.
When leaving a room, the LoadBalancingClient will disconnect the Game Server and connect to the Master Server. This wraps up multiple internal actions.
Wait for the callback OnConnectedToMaster, before you use lobbies and join or create rooms.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.

OnMasterClientSwitched() OnMasterClientSwitchedLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnMasterClientSwitched
override void Launcher_old.OnMasterClientSwitched (Player newMasterClient)[virtual]
Called after switching to a new MasterClient when the current one leaves.
This is not called when this client enters a room. The former MasterClient is still in the player list when this method get called.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.

OnPlayerEnteredRoom() OnPlayerEnteredRoomLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnPlayerEnteredRoom
override void Launcher_old.OnPlayerEnteredRoom (Player newPlayer)[virtual]
Called when a remote player entered the room.
This Player is already added to the playerlist.
If your game starts with a certain number of players, this callback can be useful to check the Room.playerCount and find out if you can start.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.
Definition at line 132 of file Launcher_Old.cs.
OnRoomListUpdate() OnRoomListUpdateLauncher_old Launcher_oldOnRoomListUpdate
override void Launcher_old.OnRoomListUpdate (List< RoomInfo > roomList)[virtual]
Called for any update of the room-listing while in a lobby (InLobby) on the Master Server.
Each item is a RoomInfo which might include custom properties (provided you defined those as lobby-listed when creating a room). Not all types of lobbies provide a listing of rooms to the client. Some are silent and specialized for server-side matchmaking.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.
